title: Scalability & Performance
content:
XWiki is written in Java/Java EE. As such it scales as well as Java scales.

# Multi Tenancy

XWiki supports the ability to run hundreds and even thousands of wikis on the same JVM (i.e. same webapp).

Some examples:

* [MyXWiki](http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome) currently hosts over 170 wikis on a single JVM
* [XWiki SAS Cloud](http://network.xwiki.com) currently hosts 1000+ wikis (but on several JVMs)

See the tutorial on [how to configure multi-tenancy](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Virtualization) to learn more.

# Clustering

XWiki provides an easy way to setup clustered instances of XWiki based on network events distribution. Clustering allows for 2 use cases:

* Load distribution on several JVMs
* Failover since if a machine is down the other ones are still available

See [Clustering](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Clustering) for more details.
